summary: People rely on the 146,000 bridges in the National Highway System. Most of the bridges are made of materials that are susceptible to corrosion—a leading cause of bridge failure. The percentage of bridges in "good" condition has declined since 2016. The Federal Highway Administration researches factors that affect bridge condition (e.g., corrosion), and provides technical assistance to states. But state officials we talked to said...
title: Highway Bridges: Federal Highway Administration Could Better Assist States with Information on Corrosion Practices
